author: Staff Reporter
text:
Hoardings and banners of political parties yet to be removed in Salem on Saturday. —Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

A day after the Model Code of Conduct was enforced in the State, banners, hoardings and wall paintings of political parties were yet to be removed in the city.

Hoardings of political parties can be found near the Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital, Thiruvakavundanur Bypass, Yercaud Main Road, Tiruchy Main Road and at other important roads in the city.

Wall paintings in medians on highways and national highways were yet to be whitewashed as officials said that it would take at least two days to complete the work.

Returning Officer and Corporation Commissioner K.R. Selvaraj said that hoardings are being removed in public places in the city and work would be completed by Monday. District Election Officer and Collector V. Sampath had asked all the political parties to remove the banners and hoardings immediately. He had asked all the local bodies to ensure that hoardings of political parties are removed by Monday evening.
title: Banners, hoardings yet to be removed
